item.title: Trongkun Manggaf√•-hu Pt. 2
item.description: I Trongkun Manggaf√•-hu P√•'gu I Bandan Nan√•-hu I Bandan Tat√•-hu Pues H√•fa P√•'gu? First things first: if you haven’t seen my first post re: my family tree then you can read it here. Okay, nihi ta tutuhun: I’ve been busy, dispensa yu'! I’ve been neck-deep in work and life in general, but I’m here now and I’m excited to share an update on my family tree!

item.title: Mama'titinas Diksion√•rion Chamoru
item.description: H√•fa adai todus hamyu guennao huyung ni' tumataitai esti! It’s been over a month-and-a-half since I’ve blogged and not a week has gone by where I thought to myself, “ai adai, debi di bai fa’tinas otru na blog”, but honestly my schedule has just been todu machalapon. I had to take a step back from dang near everything and reasses my priorities and how I spend my time outside of work - hence my absence üòÖ.

item.title: Mama'titinas Trongkun Mangg√•fa
item.description: I’ve been on a journey to document my family tree in a tech-saavy way. It started off simple: try and find out who my great-grandparents were. I honestly didn’t think I’d get past that because before this I couldn’t even tell you the names of any of my great-grandparents. But as you’ll soon find out, my simple task turned into a research-heavy adventure which is still ongoing. This wasn’t on my to-do list until recently - I’d say within the last 2 years.

item.title: Kasiyas 2020
item.description: Hu tugi' ini na poem para Kasiyas 2020; put hu sohyu' todus hamyu para konsigi fumino' Chamoru. Achokka‚Äô hinasso-mu na mapput para h√•gu, Maolek√±a kumekefino' ki pum√•para Si√±a un tutuhun p√•‚Äôgu na ha‚Äô√•ni, Lao maolek ha‚Äô yanggen ti si√±a hao.
